titleStmt.title: Elíss saga ok Rósamundar : Upps DG 4–7 : A digital edition

respStmt.resp: Transcribed the text in XML from the edition by Eugen Kölbing (1881) collating it with the facsimile edition by Mattias Tveitane (1972)

availability.p: License accepted by the editor Ingvil Brügger Budal in a mail to Odd Einar Haugen.

notesStmt.note: Til Odd Einar Haugen i høve 60-årsdagen hans 1. mai 2014.

origin.p: Written in Norway, probably in the Bergen area, c. 1270.

DG 4-7 now consists of 42 leaves in seven gatherings, each of originally 8 leaves. Thus, the complete manuscript once had (7 x 8) = 56 leaves. The first gathering lacks the middle pair and another leaf, which has been cut out. The second gathering also lacks the middle pair. The third and fourth gatherings are complete. The fifth gathering lacks the middle pair, and the sixth gathering lacks the fourth leaf, which has been cut out. The seventh gathering only has the outer pair of leaves. Remnants of the seventh gathering were found as the lining of a bishop’s mitra in Skálholt, and are now catalogued as AM 666b 4to in Copenhagen.

At the very beginning of DG 4-7, there are two leaves containing a fragment of "Óláfs saga Tryggvasonar". In the present state of the manuscript (and in the facsimile edition by Mattias Tveitane, 1972), they are fols. 1–2.

The main part of the manuscript are fols. 3–44, containing the initial two thirds of "Pamphilus saga", the concluding 13 lines of a dialogue between courage and fear, "Elis saga" and finally "Strengleikar". Note that in the facsimile edition and also in the present digital edition, the leaves have been numbered consecutively in the order they now have in the manuscript, irrespective of lost leaves and leaves which have been put in the wrong order as a result of the later binding of the book.
The information compiled here is based on the introduction in the facsimile edition by Mattias Tveitane (1972).

projectDesc.p: This manuscript text has been encoded according to the standard set out in The Menota handbook (version 2.0), at http://www.menota.org/HB_index.xml as of 2008-05-16.
The text has numbered pagebreaks according to Kölbing’s edition (referred to as "Kolbing1881"), and numbered pagebreaks, columnbreaks and linebreaks according to the manuscript.

correction.p: This text is based on Kölbing’s edition as copied by Gammalnorsk Ordboksverk, and it has subsequently been checked by the editor of this edition against a facsimile of the manuscript and corrected in several hundred cases.

normalization.p: This text has been encoded on a diplomatic level.

interpretation.p: The text has not been lemmatised and morphologically analysed.

revisionDesc.change: 2017-06-06 Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen: (1) Replaced all "me:punct" elements with "pc" elements as recommended in v. 3.0 of the Menota handbook; (2) Removed all 395 "pc type="supplied"" for hyphens supplied by the editor with nothing, as recommended in v. 3.0 of the Menota handbook and implemented in the latest version of the stylesheet used in the Corpuscle application, assuming that there are no examples of actual hyphens in the manuscript (cf. the comment to the change dated 2016-01-23 below); (3) Added a "respStmt" describing the work by the editor; (4) Made the file v. 1.0.7
2016-04-28 Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen: (1) Corrected some imbalanced "w" elements in order to make the file valid with all chapter divisions; (2) Made the file v. 1.0.6
2016-04-27 Ingvil Brügger Budal NLA University College, Bergen: Added chapter division after Kolbing 1881

2016-03-29
Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen : (1) Changed the encoding of supplied hyphens from "supplied type="hyphenated"" to "pc type="supplied"" (for hyphens supplied by the editors, and lacking in the manuscript); (2) Made the file v. 1.0.5

2016-02-21
Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen : (1) Revised the "availability" element in the header with a CC-BY-SA 4.0 licence; (2) Made the file v. 1.0.4

2016-01-23
Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen : (1) Replaced all 395 "me:punct type="supplied"" elements within "w" elements with "supplied type="hyphenated"" elements, so as to avoid having "me:punct" elements within "w" elements; (2) Made the file v. 1.0.3

2016-01-19
Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen : (1) Changed the msName to "Elíss saga ok Rósamundar"; (2) Made the file v. 1.0.2
2015-12-10 Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen: Removed three empty elements, in order to facilitate import into the Corpuscle system.

2015-08-25 Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen: Changed "pb" encoding to "cb" where applicable, so that the whole text is encoded according to page breaks (from 6r to 17v) and column breaks (two on each page, A and B).
2015-08-18 Ingvil Brügger Budal NLA University College, Bergen: Did a final control of the text; made the file into version 1.0 so that it could be published in the archive

2015-03-03 Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen: Added a new level of "div" elements so that the file can be divided into chapters according to the edition by Kölbing; made the file into version 0.9.1

2015-02-20 Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen: Inserted all words into "w" elements, specified by the ed attribute which "pb", "cb" and "lb" elements referred to the manuscript, and checked the file for various inconsistencies; made the file into version 0.9
2015-01-19 Ingvil Brügger Budal NLA University College, Bergen: Corrected the file on the basis of the proofreading by Thomas De Ridder
2015-01-05 Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen: Prepared the text for final markup, and corrected some parts of the header in cooperation with the editor
2015-01-05 Thomas De Ridder University of Bergen: Proofread the first version of the text
2014-09-19 Ingvil Brügger Budal NLA University College, Bergen: Established the first draft version of the edition
2014 Florian Grammel Copenhagen: Converted some entities, added a minimal Menota-header from The Menota handbook 2.0 for validation
2014-08-01 Ingvil Brügger Budal NLA University College, Bergen: Worked through the actual text of the manuscript
2009 Ingvil Brügger Budal NLA University College, Bergen: Began working on the document structure of the edition (such as pagebreaks, columnbreaks and linebreaks).

p.note: There is a lacuna of presumably two leaves between the present fols. 10 and 11. At the bottom of fol. 10v a younger hand has added: Desideratur folium unium aut plura. After a short space, the same hand adds: Duo folia desunt. The missing text can be reconstructed from younger Icelandic manuscripts, but has not been included here, since this is a transcription of a single manuscript, Upps DG 4-7. In Kölbing’s edition of Elis saga (1881), the text of the lacuna has been supplied from another manuscript. Chapters 25 and 26 are located in this lacuna, and are therefore missing here.
